Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class Island

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.Island
All Implemented Interfaces:
Jsonable
class Island extends Object implements Jsonable
Represents an island. Each Island has a set of game-local ids (used for the graphical rendition). An Island can receive students, be conquered by a Player by placing Towers, and be blocked by a BlockCard. Islands, if conquered by the same player, can be merged into a new Island containing all the sum of the state of the "addends". The ids are stored in order, this means that merging [3,4] into [1,2] results into a new Island with [1,2,3,4].

Island is completely immutable, every state change will generate a new Island.

    • updateStudents

      Island updateStudents(Function<StudentContainer,StudentContainer> update)
      Applies the given update to the set of students placed on this Island. If the update returns null, nothing is done.
      Parameters:
      update - a Function transforming the old StudentContainer into the new one
      Returns:
      a new Island with the update applied
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if update is null
      See Also:
      • StudentContainer

    • updateTowers

      Island updateTowers(Function<List<Tower>,List<Tower>> update)
      Applies the given update to the towers placed on the current Island. The list of towers should have towers all the same color, mismatch is not allowed.
      Parameters:
      update - a Function transforming the old set of towers in the new one
      Returns:
      a new Island with the update applied
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the list returned by update contains mismatched towers or too many towers
